visualization_prompt: Generate a polar column chart showing Winter Olympic medal distribution by country using inverted axes and flag sprite annotations

title.text: Winter Olympic medals per existing country (TOP 5)

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 3 multivariate series (medal types) across 5 categorical entities (countries). Synthetic medal counts follow normal distributions (Gold: μ=93.2, σ=26.7; Silver: μ=93.2, σ=23.7; Bronze: μ=82, σ=19.6) with domain-constrained ranges reflecting historical Olympic totals. The polar coordinate system enables cyclical comparison of national medal distributions while maintaining Tufte's data-ink ratio through minimal gridlines. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through position (angular distribution) and hue (medal tier encoding). Flag sprites enhance categorical recognition through pre-attentive pattern matching, with stacked columns leveraging length perception for quantitative comparison.
